required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Minimally Invasive Versus Open Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion
clinical_study.official_title: Minimally Invasive Versus Open Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion

brief_summary.textblock: A study that compares between Open TLIF and Minimally invasive TLIF regarding patients' functional status(Oswestry Disability index)as a primary outcome measure.

detailed_description.textblock: The first randomized controlled trial comparing minimally invasive TLIF and open TLIF.

primary_outcome.description: an index derived from the Oswestry Low Back Pain Questionnaire used by clinicians and researchers to quantify disability for low back pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: â€¢ Fusion rate as assessed by Bridwell fusion score.
secondary_outcome.description: Grade I is defined as fusion with remodelling and trabeculae present; Grade II is an intact graft with incomplete remodelling and no lucency present; Grade III is an intact graft with potential lucency at the cranial or caudal end; Grade IV is absent fusion with collapse/resorption of the graft.

arm_group.description: Spinal fusion ,Transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion procedure will be performed through open surgery.
Spinal fusion,Transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion procedure will be performed through minimally invasive surgery using a tubular retractor.

intervention.intervention_name: Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion either open or minimally invasive
intervention.description: Spinal fusion procedure through the intervertebral foramen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults more than 18 years of age and less than 65 years of age..
- Degenerative or isthmic spondylolithesis Grade 1,2 and 3.
- Recurrent Symptomatic recurrent lumbar disc prolapsed with or without evident neural compression.
- Single level pathology involving L2-3, L3-4, L4-5 and or L5-S1.
- Symptoms not responding to conservative treatment for at least 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous spinal fusion or instrumentation.
- Spinal tumours, infection and fractures.
- Patients with severe osteoporosis
- BMI more than 35.
- Non-ambulant patients and patients with severe preoperative neurological affection (Cauda Equina Syndrome)
- Patients not willing to participate in the study
